commit.message:
configure.in (hpux10, [...]): Use i128 float format.


        * configure.in (hpux10, hpux11, PA32 mode): Use i128 float format.
        * configure: Rebuilt.

From-SVN: r32263

files.patch:
@@ -1,3 +1,8 @@
+Tue Feb 29 10:45:59 2000  Jeffrey A Law  (law@cygnus.com)
+
+	* configure.in (hpux10, hpux11, PA32 mode): Use i128 float format.
+	* configure: Rebuilt.
+
 2000-02-29  Philip Blundell  <pb@futuretv.com>
 
 	* config/arm/conix-elf.h: New file.

@@ -3730,6 +3730,7 @@ for machine in $build $host $target; do
 	hppa1.1-*-hpux10* | hppa2*-*-hpux10*)
 		target_cpu_default="MASK_PA_11"
 		tm_file="${tm_file} pa/long_double.h pa/som.h pa/pa-hpux.h pa/pa-hpux10.h"
+		float_format=i128
 		xm_file=pa/xm-pahpux.h
 		xmake_file=pa/x-pa-hpux
 		tmake_file=pa/t-pa
@@ -3749,6 +3750,7 @@ for machine in $build $host $target; do
 		;;
 	hppa1.0-*-hpux10*)
 		tm_file="${tm_file} pa/long_double.h pa/som.h pa/pa-hpux.h pa/pa-hpux10.h"
+		float_format=i128
 		xm_file=pa/xm-pahpux.h
 		xmake_file=pa/x-pa-hpux
 		tmake_file=pa/t-pa
@@ -3769,6 +3771,7 @@ for machine in $build $host $target; do
 	hppa1.1-*-hpux11* | hppa2*-*-hpux11*)
 		target_cpu_default="MASK_PA_11"
 		tm_file="${tm_file} pa/long_double.h pa/som.h pa/pa-hpux.h pa/pa-hpux11.h"
+		float_format=i128
 		xm_file=pa/xm-pahpux.h
 		xmake_file=pa/x-pa-hpux
 		tmake_file=pa/t-pa
@@ -3788,6 +3791,7 @@ for machine in $build $host $target; do
 		;;
 	hppa1.0-*-hpux11*)
 		tm_file="${tm_file} pa/long_double.h pa/som.h pa/pa-hpux.h pa/pa-hpux11.h"
+		float_format=i128
 		xm_file=pa/xm-pahpux.h
 		xmake_file=pa/x-pa-hpux
 		if test x$gas = xyes
@@ -6653,15 +6657,15 @@ fi
 
 
         echo $ac_n "checking for strerror in -lcposix""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6659: checking for strerror in -lcposix" >&5
+echo "configure:6661: checking for strerror in -lcposix" >&5
 ac_lib_var=`echo cposix'_'strerror | sed 'y%./+-%__p_%'`
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_lib_$ac_lib_var'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   ac_save_LIBS="$LIBS"
 LIBS="-lcposix  $LIBS"
 cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6667 "configure"
+#line 6669 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* Override any gcc2 internal prototype to avoid an error.  */
 /* We use char because int might match the return type of a gcc2
@@ -6672,7 +6676,7 @@ int main() {
 strerror()
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:6678: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:6680: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_lib_$ac_lib_var=yes"
 else
@@ -6695,18 +6699,18 @@ fi
   
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for working const""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6701: checking for working const" >&5
+echo "configure:6703: checking for working const" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_c_const'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6706 "configure"
+#line 6708 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 
 int main() {
 
 /* Ultrix mips cc rejects this.  */
-typedef int charset[2]; const charset x = {0,0};
+typedef int charset[2]; const charset x;
 /* SunOS 4.1.1 cc rejects this.  */
 char const *const *ccp;
 char **p;
@@ -6749,7 +6753,7 @@ ccp = (char const *const *) p;
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:6755: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
+if { (eval echo configure:6757: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   ac_cv_c_const=yes
 else
@@ -6770,21 +6774,21 @@ EOF
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for inline""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6776: checking for inline" >&5
+echo "configure:6778: checking for inline" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_c_inline'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   ac_cv_c_inline=no
 for ac_kw in inline __inline__ __inline; do
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6783 "configure"
+#line 6785 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 
 int main() {
-} int $ac_kw foo() {
+} $ac_kw foo() {
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:6790: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
+if { (eval echo configure:6792: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   ac_cv_c_inline=$ac_kw; break
 else
@@ -6810,12 +6814,12 @@ EOF
 esac
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for off_t""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6816: checking for off_t" >&5
+echo "configure:6818: checking for off_t" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_type_off_t'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6821 "configure"
+#line 6823 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <sys/types.h>
 #if STDC_HEADERS
@@ -6843,12 +6847,12 @@ EOF
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for size_t""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6849: checking for size_t" >&5
+echo "configure:6851: checking for size_t" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_type_size_t'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6854 "configure"
+#line 6856 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <sys/types.h>
 #if STDC_HEADERS
@@ -6878,19 +6882,19 @@ fi
 # The Ultrix 4.2 mips builtin alloca declared by alloca.h only works
 # for constant arguments.  Useless!
 echo $ac_n "checking for working alloca.h""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6884: checking for working alloca.h" >&5
+echo "configure:6886: checking for working alloca.h" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_header_alloca_h'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6889 "configure"
+#line 6891 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <alloca.h>
 int main() {
-void *p = alloca(2 * sizeof(int));
+char *p = alloca(2 * sizeof(int));
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:6896: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:6898: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   ac_cv_header_alloca_h=yes
 else
@@ -6911,12 +6915,12 @@ EOF
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for alloca""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6917: checking for alloca" >&5
+echo "configure:6919: checking for alloca" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_alloca_works'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6922 "configure"
+#line 6924 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 
 #ifdef __GNUC__
@@ -6944,7 +6948,7 @@ int main() {
 char *p = (char *) alloca(1);
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:6950: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:6952: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   ac_cv_func_alloca_works=yes
 else
@@ -6976,12 +6980,12 @@ EOF
 
 
 echo $ac_n "checking whether alloca needs Cray hooks""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6982: checking whether alloca needs Cray hooks" >&5
+echo "configure:6984: checking whether alloca needs Cray hooks" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_os_cray'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6987 "configure"
+#line 6989 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #if defined(CRAY) && ! defined(CRAY2)
 webecray
@@ -7006,12 +7010,12 @@ echo "$ac_t""$ac_cv_os_cray" 1>&6
 if test $ac_cv_os_cray = yes; then
 for ac_func in _getb67 GETB67 getb67; do
   echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_func""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7012: checking for $ac_func" >&5
+echo "configure:7014: checking for $ac_func" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_$ac_func'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 7017 "configure"
+#line 7019 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* System header to define __stub macros and hopefully few prototypes,
     which can conflict with char $ac_func(); below.  */
@@ -7034,7 +7038,7 @@ $ac_func();
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:7040: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:7042: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_func_$ac_func=yes"
 else
@@ -7061,15 +7065,15 @@ done
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking stack direction for C alloca""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7067: checking stack direction for C alloca" >&5
+echo "configure:7069: checking stack direction for C alloca" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_c_stack_direction'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   if test "$cross_compiling" = yes; then
   ac_cv_c_stack_direction=0
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 7075 "configure"
+#line 7077 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 find_stack_direction ()
 {
@@ -7088,7 +7092,7 @@ main ()
   exit (find_stack_direction() < 0);
 }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:7094: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext} && (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null
+if { (eval echo configure:7096: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext} && (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null
 then
   ac_cv_c_stack_direction=1
 else
@@ -7113,17 +7117,17 @@ for ac_hdr in unistd.h
 do
 ac_safe=`echo "$ac_hdr" | sed 'y%./+-%__p_%'`
 echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_hdr""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7119: checking for $ac_hdr" >&5
+echo "configure:7121: checking for $ac_hdr" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_header_$ac_safe'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 7124 "configure"
+#line 7126 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <$ac_hdr>
 EOF
 ac_try="$ac_cpp conftest.$ac_ext >/dev/null 2>conftest.out"
-{ (eval echo configure:7129: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
+{ (eval echo configure:7131: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
 ac_err=`grep -v '^ *+' conftest.out | grep -v "^conftest.${ac_ext}\$"`
 if test -z "$ac_err"; then
   rm -rf conftest*
@@ -7152,12 +7156,12 @@ done
 for ac_func in getpagesize
 do
 echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_func""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7158: checking for $ac_func" >&5
+echo "configure:7160: checking for $ac_func" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_$ac_func'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 7163 "configure"
+#line 7165 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* System header to define __stub macros and hopefully few prototypes,
     which can conflict with char $ac_func(); below.  */
@@ -7180,7 +7184,7 @@ $ac_func();
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:7186: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:7188: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_func_$ac_func=yes"
 else
@@ -7205,15 +7209,15 @@ fi
 done
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for working mmap""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7211: checking for working mmap" >&5
+echo "configure:7213: checking for working mmap" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_mmap_fixed_mapped'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   if test "$cross_compiling" = yes; then
   ac_cv_func_mmap_fixed_mapped=no
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 7219 "configure"
+#line 7221 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 
 /* Thanks to Mike Haertel and Jim Avera for this test.
@@ -7240,15 +7244,12 @@ else
 #include <sys/types.h>
 #include <fcntl.h>
 #include <sys/mman.h>
-#include <stdlib.h>
-#include <sys/stat.h>
-
-#ifdef HAVE_UNISTD_H
-# include <unistd.h>
-#endif
 
 /* This mess was copied from the GNU getpagesize.h.  */
 #ifndef HAVE_GETPAGESIZE
+# ifdef HAVE_UNISTD_H
+#  include <unistd.h>
+# endif
 
 /* Assume that all systems that can run configure have sys/param.h.  */
 # ifndef HAVE_SYS_PARAM_H
@@ -7303,7 +7304,7 @@ main()
 	/*
 	 * First, make a file with some known garbage in it.
 	 */
-	data = (char*)malloc(pagesize);
+	data = malloc(pagesize);
 	if (!data)
 		exit(1);
 	for (i = 0; i < pagesize; ++i)
@@ -7324,7 +7325,7 @@ main()
 	fd = open("conftestmmap", O_RDWR);
 	if (fd < 0)
 		exit(1);
-	data2 = (char*)malloc(2 * pagesize);
+	data2 = malloc(2 * pagesize);
 	if (!data2)
 		exit(1);
 	data2 += (pagesize - ((int) data2 & (pagesize - 1))) & (pagesize - 1);
@@ -7342,7 +7343,7 @@ main()
 	 */
 	for (i = 0; i < pagesize; ++i)
 		*(data2 + i) = *(data2 + i) + 1;
-	data3 = (char*)malloc(pagesize);
+	data3 = malloc(pagesize);
 	if (!data3)
 		exit(1);
 	if (read(fd, data3, pagesize) != pagesize)
@@ -7356,7 +7357,7 @@ main()
 }
 
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:7362: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext} && (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null
+if { (eval echo configure:7361: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext} && (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null
 then
   ac_cv_func_mmap_fixed_mapped=yes
 else
@@ -7384,17 +7385,17 @@ unistd.h sys/param.h
 do
 ac_safe=`echo "$ac_hdr" | sed 'y%./+-%__p_%'`
 echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_hdr""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7390: checking for $ac_hdr" >&5
+echo "configure:7389: checking for $ac_hdr" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_header_$ac_safe'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 7395 "configure"
+#line 7394 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <$ac_hdr>
 EOF
 ac_try="$ac_cpp conftest.$ac_ext >/dev/null 2>conftest.out"
-{ (eval echo configure:7400: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
+{ (eval echo configure:7399: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
 ac_err=`grep -v '^ *+' conftest.out | grep -v "^conftest.${ac_ext}\$"`
 if test -z "$ac_err"; then
   rm -rf conftest*
@@ -7424,12 +7425,12 @@ done
 strdup __argz_count __argz_stringify __argz_next
 do
 echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_func""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7430: checking for $ac_func" >&5
+echo "configure:7429: checking for $ac_func" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_$ac_func'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 7435 "configure"
+#line 7434 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* System header to define __stub macros and hopefully few prototypes,
     which can conflict with char $ac_func(); below.  */
@@ -7452,7 +7453,7 @@ $ac_func();
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:7458: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:7457: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_func_$ac_func=yes"
 else
@@ -7481,12 +7482,12 @@ done
      for ac_func in stpcpy
 do
 echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_func""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7487: checking for $ac_func" >&5
+echo "configure:7486: checking for $ac_func" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_$ac_func'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 7492 "configure"
+#line 7491 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* System header to define __stub macros and hopefully few prototypes,
     which can conflict with char $ac_func(); below.  */
@@ -7509,7 +7510,7 @@ $ac_func();
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:7515: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:7514: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_func_$ac_func=yes"
 else
@@ -7543,19 +7544,19 @@ EOF
 
    if test $ac_cv_header_locale_h = yes; then
     echo $ac_n "checking for LC_MESSAGES""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7549: checking for LC_MESSAGES" >&5
+echo "configure:7548: checking for LC_MESSAGES" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'am_cv_val_LC_MESSAGES'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 7554 "configure"
+#line 7553 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <locale.h>
 int main() {
 return LC_MESSAGES
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:7561: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:7560: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   am_cv_val_LC_MESSAGES=yes
 else
@@ -7576,7 +7577,7 @@ EOF
     fi
   fi
    echo $ac_n "checking whether NLS is requested""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7582: checking whether NLS is requested" >&5
+echo "configure:7581: checking whether NLS is requested" >&5
         # Check whether --enable-nls or --disable-nls was given.
 if test "${enable_nls+set}" = set; then
   enableval="$enable_nls"
@@ -7596,7 +7597,7 @@ fi
 EOF
 
       echo $ac_n "checking whether included gettext is requested""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7602: checking whether included gettext is requested" >&5
+echo "configure:7601: checking whether included gettext is requested" >&5
       # Check whether --with-included-gettext or --without-included-gettext was given.
 if test "${with_included_gettext+set}" = set; then
   withval="$with_included_gettext"
@@ -7615,17 +7616,17 @@ fi
 
 	ac_safe=`echo "libintl.h" | sed 'y%./+-%__p_%'`
 echo $ac_n "checking for libintl.h""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7621: checking for libintl.h" >&5
+echo "configure:7620: checking for libintl.h" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_header_$ac_safe'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 7626 "configure"
+#line 7625 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <libintl.h>
 EOF
 ac_try="$ac_cpp conftest.$ac_ext >/dev/null 2>conftest.out"
-{ (eval echo configure:7631: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
+{ (eval echo configure:7630: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
 ac_err=`grep -v '^ *+' conftest.out | grep -v "^conftest.${ac_ext}\$"`
 if test -z "$ac_err"; then
   rm -rf conftest*
@@ -7642,19 +7643,19 @@ fi
